message.content:
cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SE

This paper focuses on the security evaluation of two popular smart home platforms, which involves examining access control enforcement, non-system enforcement procedures, and potential misuse of routines. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Additionally, the paper also discusses the usability and design of the platforms, which could fall under cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also involves analyzing data stores and centralized systems, which could be categorized under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.CY (Computers and Society). Finally, the paper discusses the importance of enforcing security by design in emerging home automation platforms, which could fall under cs.SE (Software Engineering).
